comments:
This code is illegal because an array type cannot be a bound:

class Foo<T extends int[]> {
}

However, this crashes the compiler:

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.ArrayBinding
at

Doesn't matter if the arrays component type is primitive or a reference type
(including type variables).

Added missing check for type parameter bounds.
Added GenericTypeTest#test461.
Fixed
